intro: Biscutella maestratensis, commonly known as the Maestrat biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Biscutella maestratensis is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates.
